LanguageData.AEXP_Alligator.label: alligator
LanguageData.AEXP_Alligator.description: The alligator is a large reptile that inhabits freshwater wetlands. They are apex predators and consume fish, amphibians, reptiles, birds, and mammals. Like other crocodilians, healthy alligators may continue to grow throughout their lives.
LanguageData.AEXP_Anaconda.label: anaconda
LanguageData.AEXP_Anaconda.description: The anaconda is the heaviest and one of the longest known snake species, reaching lengths of 5 meters. They are a primarily nocturnal species that tends to spend most of its life in or around water.
LanguageData.AEXP_Anaconda.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.AEXP_IndianElephant.label: indian elephant
LanguageData.AEXP_IndianElephant.description: The Indian elephant is one of the largest unmodified land animals. In general, Indian elephants are smaller, have smaller ears, but relatively broader skulls and larger trunks than African elephants, and have the highest body point on the head.
LanguageData.AEXP_IndianElephant.tools.0.label: left foot
LanguageData.AEXP_IndianElephant.tools.1.label: right foot
LanguageData.AEXP_IndianElephant.tools.2.label: head
